title: Update 1.1.3 to 1.2.2 lost my ether balance
body:
I was running version 1.1.3:

```
J:\processes\geth>geth --rpc console
I1003 09:20:34.364947   68880 database.go:73] Alloted 16MB cache to C:\Users\PC\AppData\Roaming\Ethereum\chaindata
I1003 09:20:34.573092   68880 database.go:73] Alloted 16MB cache to C:\Users\PC\AppData\Roaming\Ethereum\dapp
I1003 09:20:34.620975   68880 backend.go:291] Protocol Versions: [61 60], Network Id: 1
I1003 09:20:34.622930   68880 backend.go:328] Blockchain DB Version: 3
I1003 09:20:34.625862   68880 chain_manager.go:237] Last block (#324431) 54835baf12f0b9a95bd709b553ca271d1f5c396f367bcd48b56b95a227a0843c TD=1549036119521575734
I1003 09:20:34.689380   68880 cmd.go:125] Starting Geth/v1.1.3/windows/go1.4.2
I1003 09:20:34.689380   68880 server.go:311] Starting Server
I1003 09:20:36.552912   68880 nat.go:111] mapped network port udp:30303 -> 30303 (ethereum discovery) using UPNP IGDv1-PPP1
I1003 09:20:36.718060   68880 udp.go:207] Listening, enode://82f0b38d425802704fe66dfcce158d84bac6202d45abbb910a38e7895f64d62dd33cae479425bb55a1fb63c312737e2642fa74e7eb03c92addb7783e81e69e47@81.240.129.46:30303
I1003 09:20:36.719038   68880 backend.go:557] Server started
I1003 09:20:36.719038   68880 ipc_windows.go:724] IPC service started (\\.\pipe\geth.ipc)
I1003 09:20:36.719038   68880 server.go:552] Listening on [::]:30303
I1003 09:20:36.733696   68880 nat.go:111] mapped network port tcp:30303 -> 30303 (ethereum p2p) using UPNP IGDv1-PPP1
instance: Geth/v1.1.3/windows/go1.4.2
 datadir: C:\Users\PC\AppData\Roaming\Ethereum
coinbase: 0x9f2416d4269ee4171db1ab5e090ec5a8dcab0bc2
at block: 324431 (Fri, 02 Oct 2015 23:48:52 CEST)
modules: admin:1.0 db:1.0 debug:1.0 eth:1.0 miner:1.0 net:1.0 personal:1.0 shh:1.0 txpool:1.0 web3:1.0
> I1003 09:20:46.720742   68880 downloader.go:278] Block synchronisation started
I1003 09:20:49.630863   68880 chain_manager.go:661] imported 46 block(s) (0 queued 1 ignored) including 25 txs in 1.5537587s. #324477 [54835baf / 408d4b88]
:
```

My ether balance was this:

```
J:\processes\geth>geth attach
instance: Geth/v1.1.3/windows/go1.4.2
 datadir: C:\Users\PC\AppData\Roaming\Ethereum
coinbase: 0x9f2416d4269ee4171db1ab5e090ec5a8dcab0bc2
at block: 318613 (Thu, 01 Oct 2015 20:30:07 CEST)
modules: admin:1.0 db:1.0 debug:1.0 eth:1.0 miner:1.0 net:1.0 personal:1.0 shh:1.0 txpool:1.0 web3:1.0
> web3.fromWei(eth.getBalance(eth.coinbase),"ether")
0.61195551553228672
:
:
(still running, next lines after crash description)
```

Then geth 1.1.3 crashed last night with this:

```
I1002 23:48:55.346655   74880 chain_manager.go:661] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 0 txs in 3.9078ms. #324430 [d8fb461a / d8fb461a]
I1002 23:48:55.353496   74880 worker.go:540] commit new work on block 324431 with 0 txs & 0 uncles. Took 5.8635ms
I1002 23:49:30.360928   74880 chain_manager.go:661] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 0 txs in 4.886ms. #324431 [54835baf / 54835baf]
I1002 23:49:30.371677   74880 worker.go:540] commit new work on block 324432 with 0 txs & 0 uncles. Took 10.7491ms
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal 0xc0000005 code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0x880e0e]

goroutine 757229 [running]:
github.com/syndtr/goleveldb/leveldb.(*dbIter).Release(0xc0858c42d0)
        D:/builds/geth_win32/build-go-win-master/build/Godeps/_workspace/src/github.com/syndtr/goleveldb/leveldb/db_iter.go:333 +0x16e
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/p2p/discover.(*nodeDB).querySeeds(0xc083a8d650, 0xa, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
        D:/builds/geth_win32/build-go-win-master/go/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/p2p/discover/database.go:340 +0x364
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/p2p/discover.(*Table).refresh(0xc08370a000)

...

// @obscuren: removed output due to solved bug

...
```

I restarted...

And checked by balance:

```
(follow up from above)
:
:
(still running, next lines after crash description)
> web3.fromWei(eth.getBalance(eth.coinbase),"ether")
2.073359062020619136
> exit
```

Then, I check the version on the release history and installed the update to 1.2.2:

```
J:\processes\geth_1.2.2>geth --rpc console
I1003 09:33:01.616881   90312 database.go:71] Alloted 16MB cache to C:\Users\PC\AppData\Roaming\Ethereum\chaindata
I1003 09:33:01.792778   90312 backend.go:712] Old database detected, upgrading...
I1003 09:34:42.480188   90312 database.go:71] Alloted 16MB cache to C:\Users\PC\AppData\Roaming\Ethereum\dapp
I1003 09:34:42.535889   90312 backend.go:291] Protocol Versions: [62 61], Network Id: 1
I1003 09:34:42.558363   90312 backend.go:333] Blockchain DB Version: 3
I1003 09:34:42.562273   90312 chain_manager.go:248] Last block (#326557) 291e7286cb78ae83f2da428e2388e4cd7e0ab25a5d12980261155a64ae4e8070 TD=1562148790322764539
I1003 09:34:42.582795   90312 cmd.go:125] Starting Geth/v1.2.2/windows/go1.4.2
I1003 09:34:42.583772   90312 server.go:311] Starting Server
I1003 09:34:42.695172   90312 udp.go:204] Listening, enode://82f0b38d425802704fe66dfcce158d84bac6202d45abbb910a38e7895f64d62dd33cae479425bb55a1fb63c312737e2642fa74e7eb03c92addb7783e81e69e47@[::]:30303
I1003 09:34:42.695172   90312 backend.go:559] Server started
I1003 09:34:42.695172   90312 server.go:552] Listening on [::]:30303
I1003 09:34:42.719604   90312 ipc_windows.go:724] IPC service started (\\.\pipe\geth.ipc)
instance: Geth/v1.2.2/windows/go1.4.2
 datadir: C:\Users\PC\AppData\Roaming\Ethereum
coinbase: 0x9f2416d4269ee4171db1ab5e090ec5a8dcab0bc2
at block: 326557 (Sat, 03 Oct 2015 09:32:22 CEST)
modules: admin:1.0 db:1.0 debug:1.0 eth:1.0 miner:1.0 net:1.0 personal:1.0 shh:1.0 txpool:1.0 web3:1.0
> I1003 09:34:52.696878   90312 downloader.go:275] Block synchronisation started
I1003 09:34:55.494618   90312 chain_manager.go:722] imported 2 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 0 txs in 1.3680899s. #326559 [a8437ac5 / 61c68a0f]
I1003 09:34:55.584522   90312 chain_manager.go:722] imported 7 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 11 txs in 89.904ms. #326566 [cd34266d / 65bc273b]
I1003 09:35:00.620064   90312 chain_manager.go:722] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 0 txs in 5.8633ms. #326567 [e96d7f35 / e96d7f35]
I1003 09:35:05.274497   90312 chain_manager.go:722] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 0 txs in 4.8861ms. #326568 [11cc153e / 11cc153e]
I1003 09:35:36.779623   90312 chain_manager.go:722] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 0 txs in 7.8182ms. #326569 [60c1ef07 / 60c1ef07]
:
:
```

Please note the "90312 backend.go:712] Old database detected, upgrading..."

I also restarted an attached geth console:

```
J:\processes\geth_1.2.2>geth attach
instance: Geth/v1.2.2/windows/go1.4.2
 datadir: C:\Users\PC\AppData\Roaming\Ethereum
coinbase: 0x9f2416d4269ee4171db1ab5e090ec5a8dcab0bc2
at block: 326615 (Sat, 03 Oct 2015 09:49:15 CEST)
modules: admin:1.0 db:1.0 debug:1.0 eth:1.0 miner:1.0 net:1.0 personal:1.0 shh:1.0 txpool:1.0 web3:1.0
> web3.fromWei(eth.getBalance("0x9f2416d4269ee4171db1ab5e090ec518dcab0bc2"),"ether")
0
>
```

For comparison, with 1.1.3, coinbase and  data directory and address are the same as above.

Question: what happened? Where is my Ether?

Thanks!
your balance is still there; try to re-sync your geth daemon and check again

First of all, and i don't know if this was intended or not, the `console` basically does the same thing as an `geth attach` but all in the same window.

When you're running with `geth console` and check the balance from that window, does it still show `0`?

I have tested around (restarts etc), and now it works. I don't know what happened or/and what I did (or did wrong), but the balance shows well now. 

Thanks a lot for the hyper-fast reply!!

(I was not worried, just thought it would be good to report a potential issue asap. I'll close the issue).

Finally:

re-sync - my (new) geth client runs in parallel and is nicely downloading new blocks. Out of curiosity and thirst for understanding, would you indicate to me how to "re-sync" without deleting the blockchain database and restart everything, I would be ether-nally grateful :)

console/attach - yes, it was intended. I use the attached console to play around with commands, and the main console here and then for tests and graceful exit, while having the log output to the console too.

You cannot resync without deleting the old chain. It would be quite messy to maintain multiple version of the database and try to merge them together. However, there's a fast sync coming very soon that can sync up the current chain in about 90 seconds, so that should help a lot ;)
